languageTools.program.agent

Class GOALProgram

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.parser.ParsedObject
      • languageTools.program.agent.GOALProgram
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IParsedObject, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ParsedObject>

    public class GOALProgram
extends ParsedObject

    Container for a parsed GOAL agent program. An agent program consists of a set of modules which in turn consist of a knowledge base, a belief base (only allowed in the init module), a goal base, a program section (which is a set of action rules), and an action specification section. All sections except for the program section are optional; only the init module does not need to have a program section.

    Use the GOALParser to create an agent program from a text file. When the parser has finished, call GOALProgramValidator for validating and post-processing the the program.

    Author:
    W.Pasman, K.Hindriks, N.Kraayenbrink
    See Also:

      • GOALProgram

        public GOALProgram(java.lang.String name,
           KRlanguage language,
           InputStreamPosition source)
        Creates an empty program container with name and KR language set.
        Parameters:
        name - name specified in GOAL program, generic type name; refer to MAS file for specific agent names.
        language - The KR language used by the new program.
        source - The location of the start of the new program's definition. May be null if not created by a parser.

      • usesMentalModels

        public boolean usesMentalModels()
        Determines if this agent program uses mental model queries. An agent uses mental model queries if it has a mental state condition with an agent expression of a type other than self or this (so variable, quantor, constant).
        Returns:
        true iff this agent program does mental model queries.
